school.name: Bloxham School
school.type: Independent co-educational boarding and day school
school.mottoTranslation: The path of the just is a shining light

location.address: Banbury Road, Bloxham, Banbury, Oxfordshire OX15 4PE

safeguardingLead.name: Jacqui Skevington
safeguardingLead.title: Assistant Head (Student Welfare and Pastoral Care)

hallmarks: A passion for learning - fostering creativity and capacity for dynamic, independent and critical thought
A balanced curriculum - challenging academic programme complemented by broader curriculum inspiring curiosity, rigour and ambition
Christian values - nurturing compassionate spirit so students become force for good
Gold standard of pastoral care - nurturing wellbeing within boarding community
Development of character - promoting responsibility, generosity, resilience and imagination

facilities: Dewey Sports Centre with 4-court sports hall

rugby.name: Rugby
rugby.description: Bloxham's rugby programme is one of the finest in the region. The 1st XV won the National Schools Plate in 2018/19 and reached the final in 2019/20. With 15 teams fielded in 2021, there's a place for every boy regardless of ability, complemented by excellent facilities, strength and conditioning coaches, and a 7-a-side programme.

hockey.name: Hockey
hockey.description: Hockey is the largest and most popular sport at Bloxham, offering challenging fixtures against well-reputed schools. Boys play in the Lent term while girls compete in Michaelmas. Strong links with Banbury Hockey Club provide additional opportunities, with several hockey specialists on staff.

cricket.name: Cricket
cricket.description: Cricket is highly popular at Bloxham with five senior teams competing. Professional coaching from George Setterfield ensures pupils develop their skills year-round, with indoor nets in Michaelmas and pre-season coaching in Lent term. Girls' cricket arrived in 2022.

netball.name: Netball
netball.description: Netball at Bloxham is a force to be reckoned with, fielding up to 16 teams. As a training hub for Wasps Netball, several Bloxham girls are on the Wasps pathway, benefiting from expert coaching under Head of Netball Lisa Manning.

swimming.name: Swimming
swimming.description: Swimming is a popular option at Bloxham, with opportunities ranging from recreational to competitive. The school pool also supports triathlon training and various aquatic activities including kayaking.

athletics.name: Athletics
athletics.description: Athletics fixtures are scheduled throughout the summer term, with opportunities for all students to compete and develop their track and field abilities.

tennis.name: Tennis
tennis.description: Tennis at Bloxham runs year-round with a winter programme in partnership with Banbury West End Tennis Club. Professional coaching and regular fixtures for both boys' and girls' teams ensure continuous development.

shooting.name: Clay Pigeon Shooting
shooting.description: Bloxham has been offering clay pigeon shooting since 1987 and has become a national powerhouse, winning the national championship six times. In 2022, the A Team became Independent School Champions with a combined score of 342.

equestrian.name: Equestrian
equestrian.description: The equestrian squad at Bloxham is thriving, welcoming riders of all levels to NSEA and SEG events. Regular qualifiers for National Championships, with training available even for non-horse owners at local riding schools.

chapelChoir.name: Chapel Choir
chapelChoir.description: The Chapel Choir is at the heart of musical life at Bloxham, performing regularly in the beautiful school chapel and at external engagements. Open to audition, it offers a wonderful opportunity to develop choral skills in a supportive environment.

exhamChapelChoir.name: Exham Chapel Choir
exhamChapelChoir.description: The Exham Chapel Choir provides an introduction to choral singing for Lower School pupils, building confidence and musicianship from Year 7.

concertBand.name: Concert Band
concertBand.description: The Concert Band brings together wind, brass and percussion players for an exciting repertoire ranging from classical arrangements to contemporary pieces.

jazzBand.name: Jazz Band
jazzBand.description: For students interested in jazz, the Jazz Band offers opportunities to explore improvisation and jazz standards in a relaxed, creative environment.

stringGroups.name: String Groups
stringGroups.description: Various string ensembles cater to different abilities, from beginners to advanced players, performing a wide repertoire of chamber music.

brassEnsemble.name: Brass Ensemble
brassEnsemble.description: The Brass Ensemble provides opportunities for brass players to develop ensemble skills and perform at school events.

music.firstFormScheme: Musicians of the Future - All First Form pupils learn an instrument for free and join the choir

drama.description: Drama at Bloxham is run with energy, focused on building confidence and creativity. The annual inter-house drama competition and whole-school production provide opportunities for all students, while LAMDA exams are available for those seeking formal qualifications.

dofe.description: One of the largest Duke of Edinburgh providers in Oxfordshire

ccf.description: Three-quarters of Third Form join the CCF, developing leadership skills through weekly activities and termly overnight exercises.

facilities.greatHall: Seats 230, stage and balcony, 7 classrooms, adjacent Jubilee Court
facilities.chapel: Opened 1871, seats 150, recently updated with flat screen TVs
facilities.vallanceLibrary: Carnegie Centre of Excellence Gold Status
facilities.whiteLionCentre: Sixth Form centre with cafe, study spaces, and socialising areas
facilities.palmerHealthCentre: On-site medical facility with registered nurses
